issue.title: Changed some functions back into macros to avoid compile errors (issue 48)
issue.body:
As reported in issue #48, the some init functions in ssl_locl.h resulted in compile errors (notably in gcc 8, a compiler we didn't test so far). Moreover, these same functions created "unused function" warnings in non-oqs-related files importing the header.

This PR changes these functions back into macros, like they were before PR #45 was merged. This supercedes PR #50.

comment.body: Appears to compile aside from the issues addressed by #49. Also looks good.

issue.title: Replace function by #define for compile-time initialisation
issue.body: This should fix #48 (in combination with fixes from #49)

comment.body: This PR shouldn't have been merged; it is superceded by PR #51.

comment.body: You based #51 on this commit; because #51 got merged, including 392d53a; this commit got automatically marked as merged.

issue.title: needed to build shared library with other shared libraries like openssl
Ensure wiki documentation is up to date

comment.body:
I've removed the old references to RAND/KEX etc in the coding conventions wiki:
https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Coding-conventions

One TODO exists. on the master branch there is something I don't recognise with the sigs. There's src/sig/sig_[algorithm] dirs and and src/sig/[algorithm] dirs. I'm not sure what the difference is between them.

issue.title: OpenSSL 1.0.2 build failure on Windows
issue.body: First error is that `oqs/oqs.h` can't be found while building `ssl3.h`.
